channel.title: Python on Paul Simmering's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Python on Paul Simmering's blog

item.title: Data frame wars: Choosing a Python dataframe library as a dplyr user
item.description: I’m a long time R user and lately I’ve seen more and more signals that it’s worth investing into Python. I use it for NLP with spaCy and to build functions on AWS Lambda. Further, there are many more data API libraries and machine learning libraries for Python than for R. Adopting Python means making choices on which libraries to invest time into learning.

item.title: FANGMANT: Tech stock analysis with pandas
item.description: The acronym FANGMANT stands for Facebook, Apple, Netflix, Google, Microsoft, Amazon, Nvidia and Tesla. Large, highly profitable US tech companies that dominate their respective markets. Other common acronyms are FANG, FAANG and FANGMAN. In this article, I’m analyzing their stock performance from 2016 to 2021. Disclaimer: This article is not financial advice. It’s a data analysis for fun. Download with yfinance yfinance is a Python package that downloads financial data from Yahoo!

item.title: Cosmention
item.description: An AI-powered social media monitoring tool for the cosmetics industry. A fully automated data pipeline starting from social media APIs and ending in a customizable dashboard. I am the inventor and lead developer and started the project as an independent SaaS offering. It was acquired by Q Insight Agency and is now in use at dm, the largest drug store chain in Europe. I presented the data pipeline in 2021 at the BVM (German association of social and market researchers) symposium on artificial intelligence and wrote an article on Marktforschung.
